data.title: Eclipse of the Public Corporation
data.meta_description: New organizations are emerging in its place—organizations that are corporate in form but have no public shareholders and are not listed or traded on organized exchanges. These organizations use public and private debt, rather than public equity, as their major source of capital. Their primary owners are not households but large institutions and entrepreneurs that […]
data.text:
MJ

Michael C. Jensen, the Jesse Isidor Straus Professor of Business Administration, Emeritus, at Harvard Business School in Boston, is the managing director of the organizational strategy practice of the Monitor Group, a collection of global professional services firms with headquarters in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
